data.text:
Average daily temperature during the week of 15 July 2024 - 21 July 2024 was 27Â Â°CÂ (81Â Â°F), average minimal (night) temperature was 16Â Â°CÂ (61Â Â°F). The current temperatures are slightly above the long-term average for Hannover, with the daily and nighttime temperatures being 24Â Â°CÂ (75Â Â°F) and 13Â Â°CÂ (55Â Â°F), respectively. In the middle, Wednesday was coldest day of the week. On average, the temperatures during various times of day (in local time) were recorded as: 7am 18Â Â°CÂ (64Â Â°F), 10am 23Â Â°CÂ (73Â Â°F), 1pm 26Â Â°CÂ (79Â Â°F), 4pm 26Â Â°CÂ (79Â Â°F), 7pm 24Â Â°CÂ (75Â Â°F), 10pm 20Â Â°CÂ (68Â Â°F).

There were 3Â days without rain, 3Â days with light rain and 1Â day with moderate rain during this week. The total precipitation for the week in Hannover was 28Â mmÂ (1.10Â in), which is above the area's average of 16Â mmÂ (0.63Â in). On average, the cloud coverage during daylight hours (from dawn to dusk) was 13Â %. The meteorological event(s) that occurred was: mist.

The wind's speed averaged 2.4Â m/s. The atmosferic pressure ranged from 1006Â hpa to 1024Â hpa. On average, the air humidity in Hannover was 73Â %.

On average, there were 15Â hours clear skies, 0.5Â hours partially overcast skies, 1.5Â hours overcast skies and 1Â hour rainy weather during the daytime (from dawn to dusk). The sunrise on average occurred at 05:21, and the sunset occurred at 21:33.

Weather overview

The city of Hannover in Germany is characterized by a temperate climate with varying day temperatures ranging from an average low of 4Â Â°CÂ (40Â Â°F) in the cold month of January to a welcoming average high of 24Â Â°CÂ (75Â Â°F) in the warm month of July. The lowest night temperatures are typically experienced in January, hitting an average of -1Â Â°CÂ (30Â Â°F). Conversely, the warmest nights occur in July with temperatures reaching an average of 13Â Â°CÂ (56Â Â°F). Amidst these overall trends, April stands out as the month with the least precipitation, recording an average of 10Â days with rainfall, while January is noted for having the highest frequency of rainy days, averaging at 13Â days. Overall, Hannover's weather patterns show a blend of clear skies and rain throughout the year, which contributes to its mild climate.

January weather

In Hannover, the minimum daytime temperature is recorded at 4Â Â°CÂ (40Â Â°F), with equally significant minimum nighttime levels at -1Â Â°CÂ (30Â Â°F). The peak number of rainy days is registered this month, topping at 13Â days. An increase in the number of sunlit hours begins now, while wind speeds reach their zenith.

February weather

Hannover starts to experience a mild uptick in daytime temperatures, now averaging 5Â Â°CÂ (41Â Â°F). The quantity of rainfall is at its lowest for the year, accumulating to 42Â mmÂ (1.65Â in), and there is a noticeable decrease in the number of rainy days. The duration of sunlight continues its upward trend, now averaging 3Â hours.

March weather

The ascending pattern of daytime temperatures becomes more pronounced at 9Â Â°CÂ (49Â Â°F) in Hannover, coupled with the initial rise in nighttime temperatures, reaching 1Â Â°CÂ (34Â Â°F). The rainfall volume starts to swell this month, and the continued ascendancy in the number of hours of sunshine is evident, now at 3Â hours.

April weather

Daytime warmth escalates further to 15Â Â°CÂ (58Â Â°F) in Hannover, while nighttime temperatures also see a rise, marked at 4Â Â°CÂ (40Â Â°F). The minimal number of rainy days occurs in April, and a decline in rainfall volume commences, noted at 42Â mmÂ (1.66Â in). The sunny hours stretch even longer, up to 5Â hours.

May weather

A steady increase in May's daytime temperatures is observed, with values reaching 19Â Â°CÂ (67Â Â°F) in Hannover. The beginning of a climb in the number of rainy days is evident, at 10Â days, matched by a rise in the total rainfall at 58Â mmÂ (2.28Â in). As the tourist season launches, the peak of sunlit hours is recorded. Minimum humidity is experienced this month.

June weather

June initiates the peak of the tourist season in Hannover. Rainy days persist, averaging 12Â days, and rainfall continues to ascend to 67Â mmÂ (2.63Â in). Elevating day and night temperatures reach 22Â Â°CÂ (71Â Â°F) and 11Â Â°CÂ (52Â Â°F), respectively. Daylight achieves its maximum duration at 16Â hours.

July weather

Tourist influx nears its peak amidst the maximum daytime temperature reaching 24Â Â°CÂ (75Â Â°F), while nighttime warmth also hits a high at 13Â Â°CÂ (56Â Â°F). Wind speeds decrease to their minimum, registering at 3. Rainfall peaks at 68Â mmÂ (2.69Â in).

August weather

The start of a decline in rainy days is noted, coming in at 12Â days, while the tourist season maintains its momentum.

September weather

Tourists continue to enjoy Hannover in September, with a downturn in both day and nighttime temperatures. The number of rainy days also declines slightly to 11Â days, and rainfall begins its descent. The reduction in sunlit hours becomes noticeable, now at 5Â hours.

October weather

Daytime temperatures in October continue their fall, averaging 14Â Â°CÂ (58Â Â°F) in Hannover, as do the nighttime temperatures, averaging 6Â Â°CÂ (43Â Â°F). The diminishing number of sunlit hours continues apace, now documenting 3Â hours.

November weather

A rise in the number of rainy days is noted, averaging 12Â days, while temperatures continue their descent, with the day averaging 9Â Â°CÂ (47Â Â°F) and the night at 3Â Â°CÂ (37Â Â°F). The downfall in hours of sunshine is apparent, now at 2Â hours.

December weather

December follows the trend with more rainy days, at an average of 13Â days, and the commencement of a rise in rainfall volume is observed. Daytime temperatures continue their decline, averaging 5Â Â°CÂ (41Â Â°F), and night temperatures descend as well, now at 0Â Â°CÂ (32Â Â°F). The shortest number of sunlit hours is evident, with values of 1Â hour. Day length also scales back to its minimum, measured at 8Â hours.
